column4: who do I talk to about getting the ubuntu rep updated? lirc is a version old
can cvs be used to update an already installed package?
not without risking to break stuff
0.8.4a appears to be in backports, according to https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/intrepid/+source/lirc/0.8.4a-0ubuntu2~intrepid1
or at least slated for backports

it actually is in backports, http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=lirc&searchon=names&suite=intrepid-backports&section=all confirms it, although it doesn't show up in my own Intrepid install. i don't know why.
you're out of luck then, unless you request a hardy backports and get it done
though honestly, you can't really complain that packages are not the latest version if you're not using the latest version of ubuntu ;)
no. adding an intrepid repository to hardy may, and generally will, have ill consequences.
you *may* try to install the *single* package from intrepid-backports, *without* adding the whole repository. that's still not guaranteed to work, and you may end up with broken packages.
if you still want to do it, download the file at http://packages.ubuntu.com/intrepid-backports/i386/lirc/download and run gdebi on it.
have you installed any new peripherals since that started happening?
any more ideas?
try 1) adding "acpi=force" to your kernel options 2) unloading all sound-related modules before shutting down (lsmod | grep snd should show them)
would that help with hibernate/resume which doesn't work either

you can try it one-off by hitting "e" in your GRUB menu, then "e" again, then adding it to the longest line you see, then hitting "b" to boot -- or you may change that permanently by adding it to /boot/grub/menu.lst (but don't do that right away)
it might
